content.body:
At https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/parsing.html#parse-error-surrogate-in-input-stream I see this note:

> Surrogates can only find their way into the input stream via script APIs such as document.write()

...but I can't find what part of the parsing algorithm it is that actually prevents surrogates from otherwise finding their way into the input stream.

There's at least nothing in the parsing algorithm that explicitly checks for surrogates, so I'm not sure what else I should be looking for...

* At https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/parsing.html#parse-error-surrogate-in-input-stream I see this note:

...but I can't find what part of the parsing algorithm it is that actually prevents surrogates from otherwise finding their way into the input stream.

There's at least nothing in the parsing algorithm that explicitly checks for surrogates, so I'm not sure what else I should be looking for...

m.new_content.body:
At https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/parsing.html#parse-error-surrogate-in-input-stream I see this note:

> Surrogates can only find their way into the input stream via script APIs such as document.write()

...but I can't find what part of the parsing algorithm it is that actually prevents surrogates from otherwise finding their way into the input stream.

There's at least nothing in the parsing algorithm that explicitly checks for surrogates, so I'm not sure what else I should be looking for...

content.body: sideshowbarker: byte to code point conversion takes care of that (i.e., the Encoding standard)
